title: File Organization Template
description: Documents the folder structure, naming conventions, backup plan, and file management approach for the worldbuilding project. Proper organization prevents lost work and enables efficient cross-referencing between world elements.

world_name.description: The name of the world being organized

subfolders.description: Names of subfolders within this folder

folder_structure.description: The hierarchical folder structure for all world files

naming_convention.description: The file naming convention used across the project (e.g., 'entity-type-name.json', 'kebab-case-with-id')

authoritative_source_rules.description: When information appears in multiple files, which file is the authoritative source? Rules for avoiding duplication.

spreadsheet_tabs.description: Overview spreadsheet tabs needed (e.g., 'settlements overview', 'gods overview', 'species overview')

version_control.description: Whether git or another version control system is used

backup_plan.description: Backup strategy to prevent data loss

changes_file_location.description: Location of the 'changes to make' file -- a running list of ideas and modifications to apply during review sessions, preventing rabbit-hole derailment during active creation

storage_platform.description: Primary storage platform for world files

cross_reference_method.description: How cross-references between files are maintained (e.g., 'JSON IDs', 'hyperlinks', 'manual notes')

x-cross-references.world-building-strategy: Organization should support the strategic scope defined in the Strategy Worksheet
x-cross-references.worldbuilding-goals: Organization should prioritize elements identified as required in the Goals Worksheet
x-cross-references.review-schedule: Regular reviews use this organization to systematically check all files
